metadata.title: CVE-2014-9911 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in the ures_getByKeyWithFallback function incommon/uresbund.cpp in International Components for Unicode (ICU) before54.1 for C/C++ allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service orpossibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted uloc_getDisplayNamecall.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9911` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu4
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu4
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu4
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu4
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu4
xul-ext-lightning - 1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu4').
